ygData.subject: Re: Question on Embedding Heritrix
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks, I ve replaced sha1-content config by two options according with the current Heritrix version. There are no WARNINGS at all. About problem solved .

Thanks, I've replaced 'sha1-content' config by two options according   
wit=
h the current Heritrix version. There are no WARNINGS at all.   
   
About =
'problem solved'. Yes, I've added the listener   
(org.archive.crawler.Weba=
ppLifecycle) to my web application, and now   
I can manage Heritrix jobs i=
nside my webapp.   
   
And one question about ARCWriterProcessor.   
Earli=
er I used Heritrix 1.10.1, and the same order.xml file I use   
now with 1.=
12.1 version.   
The point is I want to save only text/html contents in arc=
hive file, 
and the following configuration is used:   
   
<map name=3D"wr=
ite-processors">   
  <newObject name=3D"Archiver"   
   class=3D"org.archi=
ve.crawler.writer.ARCWriterProcessor">   
    <boolean name=3D"enabled">tru=
e</boolean>   
    <map name=3D"filters">   
      <newObject name=3D"conte=
ntType"   
       class=3D"org.archive.crawler.filter.ContentTypeRegExpFilt=
er">   
        <boolean name=3D"enabled">true</boolean>   
        <boolea=
n name=3D"if-match-return">true</boolean>   
        <string name=3D"regexp=
">(?i)text/html.*</string>   
      </newObject>   
    </map>   
    <bool=
ean name=3D"compress">true</boolean>   
    <string name=3D"prefix">IAH</st=
ring>   
    <string name=3D"suffix">${HOSTNAME}</string>   
    <long name=
=3D"max-size-bytes">100000000</long>   
    <stringList name=3D"path">   
 =
     <string>arcs</string>   
    </stringList>   
    <integer name=3D"poo=
l-max-active">5</integer>   
    <integer name=3D"pool-max-wait">300000</in=
teger>   
    <long name=3D"total-bytes-to-write">0</long>   
    <boolean =
name=3D"skip-identical-digests">false</boolean>   
  </newObject>   
</map>=
   
   
I noticed that with 1.12.1 version all crawled contents are saved i=
n   
archive file. Should I change something in configuration?   
   
Thank=
s for your help.   
   
Regards,   
Artem.   
   
--- In archive-crawler@ya=
hoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@...>   
wrote:   
>   
> The WARNING in=
 the below is a complaint about your order file.  It    
> states that curr=
ent Heritrix version does not know what to do with   
the    
> configurati=
on named 'sha1-content'. 'sha1-content' is a config.   
that    
> used to =
exist.   It was replaced by two options -- whether to   
digest and    
> w=
hat the digest should be (e.g. sha1, md5, etc.).  See    
> http://webteam.=
archive.org/jira/browse/HER-1074,   
>    
> In another post, I see you add=
ing the below lines to   
CATALINA_PATH:   
>    
> -Dcom.sun.management.jm=
xremote=3Dtrue   
>    
> -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=3Dfal=
se   
> -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.ssl=3Dfalse   
> -Dheritrix.properti=
es=3D/path/to/properties/file   
> -Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=3D88=
49   
>    
> You shouldn't have to do that because tomcat runs its own JMX=
   
Agent (The    
> above is starting up the JVM's JMX agent).   
>    
> =
Also in previous post, you say 'problem solved'.  Did that mean   
you have=
    
> successfully managed to embed Heritrix inside your webapp?   
>    
=
> St.Ack   
>    
> P.S. Regards embedding, you might check out the heritri=
x.war   
web.xml    
> file: src/webapps/admin/WEB-INF/web.xml. See how it =
makes use of   
the    
> class org.archive.crawler.WebappLifecycle.
